title: Federico Crescentini
text:
Federico Crescentini (13 April 1982 – 15 December 2006) was a <a href="San%20Marino">Sammarinese</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">Defender</a>. He was international with his country in eight opportunities.
Club career.
Crescentini played in the Italian amateur leagues before moving to Sanmarinese side <a href="S.P.%20Tre%20Fiori">Tre Fiori</a> in 2005.
International career.
He made his debut for <a href="San%20Marino%20national%20football%20team">San Marino</a> in a May 2002 friendly match against <a href="Estonia%20national%20football%20team">Estonia</a>, coming on as a substitute for <a href="Giacomo%20Maiani">Giacomo Maiani</a>. He earned his 8th and final cap against <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland%20national%20football%20team">Ireland</a> in November 2006, substituting <a href="Damiano%20Vannucci">Damiano Vannucci</a>.
Death.
He died while on holiday in Acapulco, <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> when he tried to help a friend in trouble, but despite rescuing her, he drowned. He was the third footballer to drown in the course of a single week, after <a href="Juventus%20FC">Juventus FC</a>'s youth players Riccardo Neri and Alessio Ferramosca drowned at the club's training ground. At the time of his death, he was 24. His funeral took place at MonteGiardino in San Marino.
